intro: Pedicularis siphonantha var. brevituba, commonly known as the short-tubed lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and clusters of small, reddish-purple flowers. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in a dense layer of fine, hairy tissue. This variety is distinguished by its shorter floral tube compared to other varieties within the species.
